content.text:
Rad Morphing Redux
v2.3.0

content.help: Enable or disable this mod. Default: OFF
Displays a warning at the start of a game when this mod is disabled. Default: ON
Reloads all settings from MCM. Use this if you have modified the settings outside of the game or in another savegame.
Seconds to wait between updating morphs. Only applies to periodic updates. Default: 1s
Restore the original companion body when they are dismissed. Default: ON
Cost to heal each percent of rads at a doctor. Default: 10 caps

content.text:
Rad Morphing Redux
v2.3.0

content.help: Enable this if you experience issues with this mod. Default: OFF

content.text:
Rad Morphing Redux
v2.3.0

content.help: With this enabled only doctors can restore your base shape. Reducing rads with RadAway or other means will have no effect on the sliders.
Enabled: rads gained after taking RadAway further increase morphs. Disabled: rads gained after taking RadAway only increase morphs if irradiation is higher than before taking RadAway.
Disabled: Unlimited additive morphing. Use at own risk!
How far additive morphing can exceed the target size increase (% of target size increase). 0 = cannot exceed target; 100 = cannot exceed 2x target

content.text: Warning! Additive morphing without a limit can lead to insane morphs!

content.help: What to do with unequipped items. Whether to simply unequip (store in inventory), drop to ground, or completely destroy the items.
Whether to override the chance to drop / destroy unequipped items.
Chance that the unequipped item id dropped / destroyed if the respective unequip action is selected.

content.text:
Rad Morphing Redux
v2.3.0
List of currently equipped items and their slot numbers for use in the unequip settings.

Rad Morphing Redux
v2.3.0

To find the correct slider names open the XML file relevant to the body you are using in Bodyslide's "SliderCategories" folder.
The attribute "displayname" is what you see in BodySlide, but here you need to enter the value of the "name" attribute.

content.help: Enter the slider names separated by "|" (e.g. Boobs|Butt|Nose). Make sure there is no leading or trailing space.
Apply this slider set to the player, companions, or both.
Apply this slider set only to actors (players and companions) of this sex.
Name of the trigger value that is used to determine morphing.
Use 100% - trigger to calculate morphs. Example: With health as a trigger, morphing increases as health goes down.
Whether to update immediately, periodically, or after sleeping. Default: Immediately

content.text:
Immediately: Changes morphs the moment a trigger value changes.
Periodically: Checks the trigger value every x seconds (update delay) and changes morphs according to current trigger value.
After sleeping: Every time you go to sleep you get additional morphs according to the current trigger value. In this update mode you can only restore your body by visiting a doctor.

content.help: At 100% the slider will be the initial value + 1 when you are fully irradiated.
Morphing starts when the trigger value reaches x%
Morphing reaches the target size increase when trigger value reaches x%
Enter slot numbers to unequip when the unequip threshold is reached. Separate multiple slots by "|" (e.g. 10|11|12). Make sure there is no leading or trailing space.
When x% of your morphing target is reached armor from the selected slots will be unequipped.
What to do with unequipped items. Whether to simply unequip (store in inventory), drop to ground, or completely destroy the items.
Chance that the unequipped item id dropped / destroyed if the respective unequip action is selected.
With this enabled only doctors can restore your base shape. Reducing the trigger value by other means will have no effect on the sliders.
Enabled: reducing and then increasing the trigger value further increase morphs.
Disabled: Unlimited additive morphing. Use at own risk!
How far additive morphing can exceed the target size increase (% of target size increase). 0 = cannot exceed target; 100 = cannot exceed 2x target

content.text: Warning! Additive morphing without a limit can lead to insane morphs!

Rad Morphing Redux
v2.3.0

v2.3.0

To find the correct slider names open the XML file relevant to the body you are using in Bodyslide's "SliderCategories" folder.
The attribute "displayname" is what you see in BodySlide, but here you need to enter the value of the "name" attribute.

content.help: Enter the slider names separated by "|" (e.g. Boobs|Butt|Nose). Make sure there is no leading or trailing space.
Apply this slider set to the player, companions, or both.
Apply this slider set only to actors (players and companions) of this sex.
Name of the trigger value that is used to determine morphing.
Use 100% - trigger to calculate morphs. Example: With health as a trigger, morphing increases as health goes down.
Whether to update immediately, periodically, or after sleeping. Default: Immediately

content.text:
Immediately: Changes morphs the moment a trigger value changes.
Periodically: Checks the trigger value every x seconds (update delay) and changes morphs according to current trigger value.
After sleeping: Every time you go to sleep you get additional morphs according to the current trigger value. In this update mode you can only restore your body by visiting a doctor.

content.help: At 100% the slider will be the initial value + 1 when you are fully irradiated.
Morphing starts when the trigger value reaches x%
Morphing reaches the target size increase when trigger value reaches x%
Enter slot numbers to unequip when the unequip threshold is reached. Separate multiple slots by "|" (e.g. 10|11|12). Make sure there is no leading or trailing space.
When x% of your morphing target is reached armor from the selected slots will be unequipped.
What to do with unequipped items. Whether to simply unequip (store in inventory), drop to ground, or completely destroy the items.
Chance that the unequipped item id dropped / destroyed if the respective unequip action is selected.
With this enabled only doctors can restore your base shape. Reducing the trigger value by other means will have no effect on the sliders.
Enabled: reducing and then increasing the trigger value further increase morphs.
Disabled: Unlimited additive morphing. Use at own risk!
How far additive morphing can exceed the target size increase (% of target size increase). 0 = cannot exceed target; 100 = cannot exceed 2x target

content.text: Warning! Additive morphing without a limit can lead to insane morphs!
